title: Argentina's Fernandez seeks dollar relief from Brazil's Lula
description: Argentine President Alberto Fernández has arrived at Brazil’s presidential residence to meet his counterpart Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva as officials from both countries study how to eschew the dollar in trade between the neighboring nations

title: Zelensky says White House told him nothing about Discord intelligence leaks
description: In an interview with The Washington Post, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky described the leak of classified U.S. intelligence as deeply damaging to his country.

title: Atletas ind�genas brasileiros celebram cultura e esporte
description: Atletas ind�genas brasileiros celebram cultura e esporte

title: Feuding Mexican cartels block roads near US border
description: Feuding Mexican cartels have briefly blocked roads in the border city of Matamoros, across from Brownsville, Texas

title: Man arrested outside Buckingham Palace with suspected weapon
description: London police say a controlled explosion has been carried out as a precaution outside Buckingham Palace after a man was arrested on suspicion of possessing an offensive weapon

title: Colombian government, rebels resume talks in Cuba
description: Colombia’s government and its largest remaining rebel group are meeting this week in Cuba to resume peace talks aimed at reaching a cease-fire and resolving a conflict dating back to the 1960s

title: Man arrested outside Buckingham Palace ahead of coronation
description: Police arrested a man outside Buckingham Palace Tuesday night after he threw suspicious items onto palace grounds.

title: 5 killed in Haiti as vigilante crowds target suspected gangs
description: Vigilante killings are surging across Haiti’s capital and beyond

title: Biden orders 1,500 more troops to Mexico border amid migration surge
description: The military personnel being mobilized will supplement Customs and Border Protection work at the border, officials said. They will not conduct law enforcement work.

title: Brazil orders Google to halt campaign against speech bill
description: Brazil’s Justice Ministry has ordered Google to stop conducting what it calls a propaganda campaign against Brazilian legislation aimed at curbing misinformation, or face about $200,000 per hour in fines

title: Crowds of those seeking rescue swell at Sudan's main seaport
description: Exhausted Sudanese and foreigners are joining growing crowds at Sudan’s main seaport

title: US, Turkey sanction 2 al-Qaida-linked militants in Mideast
description: The United States and Turkey have slapped sanctions on two al-Qaida-linked militants believed to have raised money for two militant groups operating in Syria

title: Explosion hits Revolutionary Guard base in Iran, report says
description: An explosion has struck a base in Iran belonging to the country’s paramilitary Revolutionary Guard, but no casualties or damages were reported

title: Bolivian Jesuits apologize for alleged abuse by late priest
description: Bolivia’s Jesuit congregation has apologized publicly and is launching an investigation into a late Spanish priest who allegedly abused several minors in Bolivia dating back to the 1980s

title: Russian defense chief wants wartime missile output doubled
description: Russia’s defense chief is urging a state company to double its missile output as a possible Ukrainian counteroffensive looms

title: Guatemala journalist goes on trial in money laundering case
description: The president of a Guatemalan investigative newspaper has gone on trial on money laundering charges in a case media observers are criticizing as politically motivated

title: 800,000 refugees could flee Sudan, triggering regional crisis, U.N. warns
description: The fighting has forced more than 73,000 people to flee to Sudan's neighbors, which already host a large number of refugees from past conflicts.

title: Violence flares after Palestinian hunger striker dies in Israeli prison
description: Militant groups in Gaza launched at least 26 rockets into Israel on Tuesday in retaliation for the death of a high-profile hunger striker in an Israeli prison.

title: ‘Not My King’ protests are now the norm at King Charles III’s events
description: A change of sovereign has energized the republican movement and prompted some people to look at the British monarchy anew.

title: Ugandan lawmakers pass new version of tough anti-gay bill
description: Ugandan lawmakers have passed a new version of an anti-gay bill to remove a clause which appeared to criminalize identifying as LGBTQ

title: UN summit in Qatar on Afghanistan ends, another planned
description: A closed-door summit on Afghanistan has ended in Qatar without any formal acknowledgment of the Taliban-run government there

title: U.N. struggling to strike balance in Afghanistan amid humanitarian crisis
description: The organization increasingly finds itself at the center of a debate over red lines in international support for the country.

title: China’s use of exit bans on the rise, worrying international businesses
description: The use of exit bans, combined with an expanded espionage law and raids on foreign businesses, have made international investors jittery about China.

title: King Charles III’s line of succession, visualized
description: Prince Charles has succeeded the queen. Of the next 10 royals in line to the throne, half are children.

title: Ukraine live briefing: 100,000 Russian troops killed or wounded since December, U.S. says
description: Half the Russian soldiers killed belonged to Wagner, the Kremlin-backed mercenary group involved in the heavy fighting in Bakhmut, U.S. officials said.

title: King Charles III built a town from scratch. It embodies his worldview.
description: Of all the causes he has championed, Poundbury is perhaps Charles's most fully realized vision.

title: A banana duct-taped to a wall was art. A student said eating it was, too.
description: An art student in Seoul told the Leeum Museum he ate Maurizio Cattelan’s “Comedian” because he was hungry. Another copy of the work sold for $120,000.

title: Australia cracks down on vaping, accuses Big Tobacco of targeting youths
description: Australia, which will prohibit recreational vaping, already bans children from purchasing e-cigarettes. But current rules are loosely enforced, researchers say.

title: Sudan nears ‘breaking point’ as foreigners flee
description: In recent days, Western media's focus has centered on the evacuations of foreign nationals from Sudan. Ordinary Sudanese citizens seeking an escape are not so lucky.
